titleStmt.title: To the right honourable the knights, citizens and burgesses in Parliament assembled. The humble proposal of Lewis Rawlins, whether the restraining of retailers of beer and ale within the kingdome of England and Dominion of Wales from brewing, may not only prove profitable to the crown, but be expedient; upon due consideration of subsequent reasons.
titleStmt.author: Rawlins, Lewis.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
